A. Least privilege

By implementing the principle of least privilege, organizations can minimize the risk associated with unnecessary entitlements (Recertification, user access). Users are only granted the permissions required for their specific roles and responsibilities, reducing the likelihood of intentional or unintentional harmful actions.

While the other options (B. Application monitoring, C. Separation of duty, and D. Nonrepudiation) are also important security concepts, least privilege directly addresses the issue of unnecessary entitlements by limiting access to the minimum necessary for individuals to perform their duties effectively.

Keyword entitlement -> access control (least privilege)

Which of the following would have the GREATEST impact on reducing the risk associated with the implementation of a big data project?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Data governance

Data governance involves the overall management of the availability, usability, integrity, and security of the data in an organization. In the context of a big data project, effective data governance is crucial for ensuring that data is properly managed, controlled, and used in compliance with relevant policies and regulations. It encompasses aspects such as data quality, data privacy, and data security.


While data processing (Option B), data scalability (Option C), and data quality (Option D) are all important considerations in a big data project, data governance has a broad and foundational impact on managing risks associated with data in general, making it a crucial factor for the success and risk reduction in big data implementations.

Selected Answer: C
C. Ensure segregation of duties are implemented within key systems or processes.

Segregation of duties (SoD) is a fundamental internal control measure that involves dividing tasks and responsibilities among different individuals or teams to reduce the risk of fraud and errors. By implementing segregation of duties, no single individual has complete control over a process from start to finish, making it more difficult for someone to engage in fraudulent activities without detection.

While other options, such as conducting regular internal and external audits (Option D) or requiring control owners to conduct annual control certifications (Option A), are also important components of a comprehensive risk management strategy, segregation of duties directly addresses the risk of internal fraud by minimizing the opportunities for an individual to commit fraudulent acts.

Which of the following is the MOST effective way to identify changes in the performance of the control environment?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Implement continuous monitoring.

Continuous monitoring involves the ongoing and real-time assessment of key controls, processes, and activities within an organization. It allows for the timely identification of changes or deviations from expected performance, enabling prompt response to emerging risks or control deficiencies.

While other options like evaluating key performance indicators (KPIs) (Option A), performing a control self-assessment (CSA) (Option B), and adjusting key risk indicators (KRIs) (Option D) are valuable components of a comprehensive risk management program, continuous monitoring is particularly effective for promptly detecting changes in the control environment as it provides real-time insights and facilitates proactive risk management.

Keyword : monitor -> detect change
